fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-60653].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
When configuring the filter results gadget, if there are many custom fields, the bottom of the dropdown menu can be shown off the bottom of the screen as in the screenshot below (JIRA 7.1.4 + Google Chrome)

In older versions of the product, the Dropdown menu is shown next to the gadget as below in Google Chrome, or off the screen in Firefox:

- Overly long Dropdown: 
 !long-drop7-1-4.png|thumbnail! 

- Strange menu positioning in JIRA 6.4: 
 !rendering-JIRA6-4-12.png|thumbnail! 

- Strange menu positioning in JIRA 7.1.4 (even with no results):
 !rendering-JIRA7-1-4.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Environment
This issue can be replicated with Google Chrome Version 49.0.2623.112 and Firefox version: 45.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a largish number of custom fields (say, 10 - 15)
# Create a new dashboard with a few gadgets, 
# Add the Filter Results Gadgets to the bottom of the dashboard and try to configure it
# Attempt to add an additional column to display. 
# Observe the positioning of the suggestions is inconstant. 
# The weird positioning behaviour is inconsistently reproducible, but the likelihood of replication increases when the gadget is first added and positioned on the dashboard. 

h3. Expected Results
# If low on screen real estate, the dropdown shouldn't render so many suggestions that the list falls off the screen. 
# The Dropdown should always show the full list, and be positioned under the dropdown text-field. 

h3. Actual Results
The location of the dropdown menu as shown is incorrectly sized and positioned as per the screenshots
fields.summary: Dropdown menu in gadgets displays incorrect location

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-60645].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Migration from JIRA Server to Cloud has currently this bug:
https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-60588

Basically, if the user migrate from JIRA Server to Cloud and the System timezone is different, this will cause a serious problem where dates are actually changed on migration.

This can be prevented is the user, for example, creates a Cloud instance in the same timezone as the Server. However, this can only be prevented, as we don't have a good and safe way to fix this problem after the migration is done.

Letting the customers know in advance about this problem may prevent many users with the same problem.

h3. Suggested Solution
Add a warning to [this documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/migrating-from-jira-server-to-jira-cloud-779160826.html] warning the customer to this bug and asking them to make sure the timezones match.

Suggested message:
{quote}
JIRA Server to Cloud migration is current affected by the JRA-60588 bug, which may incorrectly migrate some dates.. To prevent this problem, please make sure to migrate to a JIRA Cloud using the same timezone as the source JIRA Server.
{quote}
fields.summary: Add warning to migration documentation
Leave IssueFactory.cloneIssue(Issue) as it is

h3. Problem Definition
It would be useful if a user can see that a link to another issue exists even though this linked issue cannot be opened by the stated user. A simple example is as shown below:

John works in project AAA. 
John does not work in project BBB and cannot even see the issues of project BBB.
The team leader of project BBB has linked issue AAA-23 to issue BBB-45 from project BBB.
It would be useful for John to know that AAA-23 has got a relationship to project BBB. For example: John to be able to see that BBB-45 is linked to AAA-23 even though John cannot view BBB-45.

h3. Suggested Solution
 
A feature which will enable users to view the links for the linked issues eventhough they do not have permission but when they try to click the linked issues a message stating "You do not have permission to view the issues" is displayed.
fields.summary: Issue Linking - Make the link viewable even if the user do not have permission to access the linked issues

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-60622].
  {panel}

As a user, product owner, I want to quickly set the priority in large backlog (more than 1000 issues). 

My workflow:
- I receive email with notification that ticket was created
- I open the ticket and see how important it is
- Currently I can only quickly set "Rank to top" or "Rank to bottom" which is very useful. 
- *Problem: if I want to rank it somewhere in the middle, I need to click "View on board", choose a board, wait for the board to load and then drag&drop the ticket which is too slow when board has over 1000 issues.*

My idea is that you could add more button actions, like "Rank in the middle of backlog", "Rank after first 20% of tickets". Or you could have a vertical "slider" that allows to quickly set a rough rank on agile board, like a "mini-dragging".
See the screenshot.
fields.summary: Quick rank issues in the middle of the board

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-60619].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
# As per the [Sharing an issue|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/emailing-an-issue-269981237.html] documentation, after typing a name/email into the "User name or email" field, a drop-down list of users/emails will be displayed. 
# If you close the drop-down list without selecting a user/email, it will state "The value xxx is invalid." where xxx is the name you have inputted. 
# This is an expected behavior because there potentially could have more than 1 results such as if you have 3 users named after typing "Adam" into the field, all 3 users are displayed. 
# When you close the dropdown list without selecting anyone, it will display "The value Adam is invalid." because JIRA is not sure which user is meant to receive the email.
# The error message will also display even if there is only one user in the drop-down list of if you typed in a non-registered user email and did not select the user/email from the drop-down list.
# This can be be confusing for some users because when they fully typed in the non-registered user email and then close the drop-down list, it will display that the email is invalid.

h3. Suggested Solution
# The UI should instead point out to the user that they have to select that the user has to select the user/email from the drop-down list. 
# JIRA should proceed to send the email anyway if there is only one result and it is valid.
fields.summary: When sharing an issue through the UI, the invalid error should be less ambiguous

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-60609].
  {panel}

Consider the scenario:
Project Member Role - group A+group B
Project Administrators Role - group B

If user John is in group A and group A has global Bulk Change permission and group A is in Project Member Role for projects P1, P2, P3 with Edit Issue Project Permission in each of these then John would be able to Bulk Edit issues in all 3 projects (P1,P2,P3). 

 We want to:
1. John to be able Edit issues in P1, P2, P3
2. John to be able to Bulk Change issues in P1, P2
3. John to be denied Bulk Change issues in P3
4. Only Project Administrators who belong to group B must be able to Bulk Change issues in P3. Note John is not a member of the Project Administrators Role but group B is in both Project Member Role & Project Administrators Role for P3

If the Bulk Change was available per project under Project P3 Permission Scheme I would:
1, Grant Edit Issues to Project Members
2. Grant Bulk Change to Project Administrators
fields.summary: Grant Bulk Change permissions per project

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-60608].
  {panel}

As a user, I have a hard time keeping track of the emails I get from JIRA, and staying on top of comments out Test Analyst make or even just figure out with others complete sub-tasks.

I would like something similar to what YouTube, Facebook, Twitter, and every other type of social website provides in notifications.

As a user I would like to:
1) See a notification icon next to my user's avatar
2) When I click the icon I see a list of notifications and their associated JIRA
3) I would like to only see notifications for tasks and subtasks: that I reported, I am assigned to, or JIRAs that I am watching.
4) I would like to see notifications for: new comments that have been made, files that have been uploaded, reassignment of the JIRA, etc.

Having this small little list would be so helpful in staying in touch with others through JIRA rather than my email client. 

Sincerely,
Chad Baldwin
fields.summary: Notifications Icon/List

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-60607].
  {panel}

As a JIRA administrator, I'd like users to be able to disable (and re-enable) notifications from any desired combinations of events&projects, configurable on User Profiles, so that the Notification Scheme set on a project can satisfy multiple different needs without having to create a new Project Role for every combination of desired notifications.

!preferences.png!

Hovering the mouse cursor over the column header icon would show a tooltip with the notification's name.

Inline edit should allow changing fast the option in the cells.

Notification Schemes should limit the selectable enabled values.

This feature would only allow to receive less notifications than those set in the project's Notification Scheme.

This feature would be specially useful for notifications based on Issue Roles (reporter, assignee, watcher), as they cannot be further configurable to match different user preferences within the same project.
fields.summary: User Preference: Disable specified notification(s) from selected project(s)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-60580].

The Workflow Properties documentation page for JIRA ([Cloud|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRACLOUD/Workflow+properties] and [Server|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AdminJIRAServer071/Workflow+properties]) needs to be fixed. Specifically:

# The property jira.permission.work.denied is not documented. 
# The links to the API documentation are broken:

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-60573].
  {panel}

When we first registered users in our JIRA Cloud instance, we registered everyone in the format <firstname>.<lastname>. As our user base grew, we decided to change everyones' user login to their email address, as we could guarantee that it was unique.

This has already caused a problem in JIRA Portfolio (see JPO-1381). I believe that it has also caused an issue with the Components functionality of JIRA, which is described below.

Steps to reproduce on our Cloud instance:

# Navigate to Components section of a Project (see !Screen Shot 2016-04-12 at 22.44.02.png|thumbnail!)
# Click on Actions > Edit against any of the listed components
# Dialog box is displayed (see  !Screen Shot 2016-04-12 at 22.59.53.png|thumbnail! ) - note that the Component Lead is listed as raj.mehta (which is the way we previously had users registered in our instance)
# I tried to change myself to Component Lead. JIRA correctly found me in the instance ( !Screen Shot 2016-04-12 at 22.52.17.png|thumbnail! ) and when I clicked save the following error occurred "The user gary.bates@phe.gov.uk does not exist" (see screenshot  !Screen Shot 2016-04-12 at 22.52.29.png|thumbnail! )

However, I definitely exist in the instance with that email address! And you can see that JIRA has found my profile picture against my name too.

I believe this is highly likely to be a similar issue to JPO-1381 (the fact we have changed our user logins across our instance from <firstname>.<lastname> to email address).
fields.summary: Unable to edit components after previously changing all users' user logins from the format <firstname>.<lastname> to their email address

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-60567].

Our team manages deployments for all our cloud customers. As such, I'm marking this request for improved platform support as invalid.

We have a related Jira Server ticket for this issue, see linked issues and watch that for updates on our [Jira Server and Data Center products here.|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-60567]

Thanks!

Steve King
Product Manager
  {panel}

*Issue Summary*

Currently in JIRA, when a user performs customization to their JIRA instance, they are forced to make copy their customization out of JIRA, perform the upgrade and only then perform the upgrade back.

This is especially true for user who make changes to their databases based on our knowledge base articles [such as this one|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/ora-01461-can-bind-a-long-value-only-for-insert-into-a-long-column-error-due-to-oracle-database-definition-191500952.html].

In these a migration of serve seems the best solution as they can prepare the server before import however this would not be needed if JIRA upgrade process respects their customization.

*Expected behavior*
Either the upgrade process respects customer's customization or it allows them apply the required customization while upgrading.
fields.summary: JIRA Upgrade should maintain customization

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-60561].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

If you disassociate an issue security scheme from a project and then delete it, it doesn't actually remove that issue security level from the issue, which renders the issue inaccessible.

h3. Environment
* JIRA v7.2.0-OD-05-030

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new issue security scheme and level
# Associate that issue security scheme with a project and associate the issue security level with an issue.
# Disassociate the issue security scheme from the project, you'll be told that the security level will be removed from x issues. Nothing actually happens if you check the DB.
# Delete the security scheme
# Browse to the issue in step 2.

h3. Expected Results

Issue has no security level and anyone can see it.

h3. Actual Results

Issue can not be viewed by anyone.
 
h3.Workaround
Remove the issue security link to un-existing issue security levels
{noformat}
update jiraissue set security = null where security in (select distinct security from jiraissue where security not in (select id from schemeissuesecuritylevels ) and security is not null);
{noformat}
fields.summary: Deleting an issue security scheme does not remove it from issues and renders them inaccessible
Provide Steps on how to add additional logging levels for unlisted packages

h3. Summary
When a page on Confluence contains a special character on the page title it cannot be linked to a JIRA issue. (e.g. comma, asterisk, colon, parenthesis, etc.)

h3. Environment
Affected Confluence: 6.0.0-OD-2015.50.1-0003

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page on Confluence using the *:*;
# Go to JIRA and open an issue;
# Go to More > Link > Confluence Page
# Past the Confluence URL.

h3. Expected Results
Link the page.

h3. Actual Results
Error: {{No confluence page found with the given URL}}
LOG:
{code}
2015-12-11 11:36:48.486963500 2015-12-11 11:36:48,485 WARN [http-bio-1990-exec-1113] [auth.trustedapps.filter.TrustedApplicationFilterAuthenticator] authenticate Failed to login trusted application [wdtablesystems.atlassian.net] due to bad URL signature. Received protocol version [2]. Required protocol version [2]
2015-12-11 11:36:48.486965500  -- traceId: ef3e1376ecb62305
{code}

h3.Workaround
# Remove the *:* from the page title.
# Alternative workaround: Link the page by pageID instead, (e.g. {{CONFLUENCEURL}}/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=########)
 (The pageID can be found by mousing-over the edit button on the page and is seen on the bottom of your browser.
fields.summary: Pages with special character on the title cannot be linked with issues on JIRA

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-60546].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Tomcat has no automatic way of reporting if there's long running / stuck threads. When troubleshooting performance it can be a lot harder to know what's going on without generating thread dumps. We'd like to automatically get some more information about this.

h3. Suggested Solution

Adding this parameter to the server.xml will log stuck threads in the catalina.out:
{code}<Valve className="org.apache.catalina.valves.StuckThreadDetectionValve" threshold="60" />
{code}

This will log any request thread (eg http thread) that has been processing for more than 60 seconds. This will not log background threads, eg scheduled jobs or any long running operation that processes in the background, like import/export, reindex etc.
If you are expecting to see something in these logs that you do not, that does not mean it is not running for more than 60s. It likely just means it is not running in a request thread. Thread dumps over time are still the best way to diagnose long running threads.
fields.summary: Ship Tomcat's long running (stuck) thread logging by default

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-60538].
  {panel}

We are using JIRA 6.4.12 
System groups like jira-users, confluence-users, stash-users  are available for all users as they are the member in these System groups.
Currently a user in "Project Administrator" role is able to search and add these system groups (available in JIRA application) in his project. But the project should be added project related groups but not the system specific groups .
This is a security risk as the "Project Administrator" in JIRA can add accidentally any other system specific groups and all other members in system specific groups (who do not require the access in the project) can also get access in the project.
So the project administrators should not add system groups in their projects and there should be admin configuration to exclude application specific groups in group search screen.
Please implement the solution as this is a security issue.
fields.summary: JIRA should have admin configuration to exclude application specific groups in group search screen

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-60537].
  {panel}

When executing irreversible actions (e.g. removing issue filters), JIRA should log them as the records with the default log level.

Background of this feature request, our customer accidentally removed their issue filter and it would be better that we could easily know which filter was removed.
(FYI. Finally, we could find the filter from their database.)

Aside from this case, irreversible actions accidentally might lead to severe problems.
Logging such actions would be a good way to prove what was done by the users.

Regards,
Yuki
fields.summary: When executing irreversible action JIRA should log them as the records

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-60532].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

The {{DefaultUserPickerSearchService}} builds a query that is very slow to run on instances with many users. It seems to run faster for searches on short usernames compared to searches on long usernames (e.g. a search for "b" runs much faster than a search for "bhas").

This causes features such as mentions to perform poorly on instances with many users (e.g. JAC).

h3. Environment

This performance problem is more evident on instances with many users, such as JAC. For local testing, you can use the JIRA Data Generator Plugin to create many users (about 50,000 is necessary to start seeing a significant problem).

h3. Steps to reproduce

# Hit an endpoint which uses the user search service e.g. https://jira.atlassian.com/rest/api/2/user/viewissue/search?username=bhas&issueKey=JRA-59658

h3. Expected result

Response comes back in less than 100ms.

h3. Actual result

Response comes back in ~2.5s

h3. Notes

{{DefaultUserPickerSearchService}} ends up creating the following query:

{code}SELECT ID, directory_id, user_name, lower_user_name, active, created_date, updated_date, first_name, lower_first_name, last_name, lower_last_name, display_name, lower_display_name, email_address, lower_email_address, CREDENTIAL, deleted_externally, EXTERNAL_ID FROM PUBLIC.cwd_user WHERE (((lower_user_name LIKE  ? ) OR (lower_user_name LIKE  ? ) OR (lower_user_name LIKE  ? ) OR (lower_user_name LIKE  ? ) OR (lower_user_name LIKE  ? ) OR (lower_user_name LIKE  ? ) OR (lower_user_name LIKE  ? ) OR (lower_user_name LIKE  ? ) OR (lower_user_name LIKE  ? ) OR (lower_display_name LIKE  ? ) OR (lower_display_name LIKE  ? ) OR (lower_display_name LIKE  ? ) OR (lower_display_name LIKE  ? ) OR (lower_display_name LIKE  ? ) OR (lower_display_name LIKE  ? ) OR (lower_display_name LIKE  ? ) OR (lower_display_name LIKE  ? ) OR (lower_display_name LIKE  ? )) AND (active =  ? )) AND (directory_id =  ? ) ORDER BY lower_user_name LIMIT 100{code}

Where each LIKE is prepending a separator to the search query e.g. if you search for "Broo" it will create a LIKE for: " Broo", "-Broo", "(Broo" etc. This is so a search for "Broo" will return a user like "Mike Cannon-Brookes". The query above can be even worse if the search is also including results for users whose email address matches, as it will add another 8 LIKE clauses to the above query.

h3. Workaround

There is no workaround for this issue.
fields.summary: Slow query in user picker : DefaultUserPickerSearchService

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-60528].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
When a Project Admin who does not have JIRA Administrator Global Permissions attempts to change the Default Assignee for their Project, it generates an error stating:
{noformat}You must have global administrator rights in order to modify the project key.{noformat}
!ChangeDefaultAssignee.png|thumbnail!

Per [Defining a Project - A note about Project Administrators|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/defining-a-project-776636280.html#Definingaproject-projectadminnoteAnoteaboutprojectadministrators], Project Admins do not have the ability to change the Default Assignee. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Remove the option to change the Default Assignee for Project Admin only users
or, 
Display a useful message indicating that the Project Admin cannot change the Default Assignee because they lack JIRA Administrator Global Permissions. 
Ex:{noformat}You must have global administrator rights in order to modify the default assignee.{noformat}

h3. Workaround 
If you add the user to the {{administrators}} group, they will be able to edit the Project Lead. Or if that is not possible, another project administrator in the {{administrators}} group can make the change.
fields.summary: Display a Better Error Message when a Project Admin Attempts to Change the Default Assignee

  {panel}

h3. *Issue summary*

When a user accesses JIRA and while logging in selects the option to remember me, even if the user access JIRA everyday, the last login date fails to be updated and would refer to the day the user logged in and selected the remember me option.

This is expected begavior based on how this function is designed however, should the user need to disable users that have not logged in in a while or for taking reports of similar scenario, they would not be able to because the last date shown even in the database table is the day (s)he checked the option and logged in. Date only updated if user clears browser cache, logs in from a different browser, signs out of JIRA or deletes the login token.
h3. *Steps to Reproduce*
 # Open JIRA.
 # Enter credentials, select the remember me option and login.
 # Close the tab.
 # Open a new tab and access JIRA again.

h3. *Expected Behavior*

JIRA would launch and when it logs in using the token stored it would update the last login data in the database.
h3. *Actual Result*

JIRA would login however, the last login data is not updated due to the remember me token taking effect and making JIRA assume user never logged out.
fields.summary: Wrong Last login date because of remember me option checked

h3. Summary

The tooltip displayed when hovering over the _Create_ or _Edit_ button on the Create/Edit Issue dialog does not display correctly the keyboard shortcut to submit the dialog. Instead it displays _Undefined_  when attempting to render the correct modifier for the current browser.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

* Navigate to the Create/Edit Issue dialog.
* Hover over the Create (or Edit) button.

h3. Actual Behaviour

* The tooltip displayed renders "Press Undefined+S to submit this form"

h3. Expected Behaviour

* The tooltip should render the correct keyboard shortcut to submit the dialog for the current browser.

h3. Original Description
 !image-2016-03-29-10-50-27-227.png|thumbnail! 
Hover your mouse over either the create or the edit button on the JIRA create issue screen or edit screen. It shows "Press Undefined+S to submit this form"
fields.summary: The Edit Button and the Create Button shows "Press Undefined+S to submit this form"
Cannot navigate WYSIWYG editor (Style, color, etc) with keyboard in JIRA fields

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-60500].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Adding a Pie Chart gadget to your JIRA dashboard gives an error when the *Statistic Type* is set to the Tempo Account field and issues included in the chart have 'None' as the value for the Account field. 

h3. Environment
* JIRA Core Cloud
* Tempo Timesheets

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a project, with issues using the 'Accounts' field in Tempo
# Create some issues in the project and ensure that the 'Accounts' field has the value 'None' for a few of the issues.
# Create a filter for all issues in the project 
!original issue filter.png|thumbnail! 
# From the Search page, click on *Export* and select *Charts*
# Select 'Pie Chart' from the list
# Select 'Edit' and change the Statistic Type to *Account* and click the 'Save' button
# The preview is displayed  
!preview.png|thumbnail! 
# Click on 'Save to Dashboard' and select a dashboard 

h3. Expected Results
The pie chart displays on the dashboard as it did in the 'charts' preview.
(this works for other field types with 'None' values)

h3. Actual Results
The gadget on the dashboard displays an error message
 !error.png|thumbnail! 

{noformat}
Unfortunately, one or more of your preferences are now unavailable. Please update your preferences, or remove gadget by clicking delete from the title bar above.
500

h3.Workaround
Edit your filter to exclude issues where the Account field is set to None. 
{noformat}project = JST4 and Account != None{noformat}
 !modified issue filter for workaround.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: JIRA Pie Chart Macro gives error when Tempo Accounts field is set to None

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-60497].
  {panel}

The sample dbconfig.xml on https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/connecting-jira-to-sql-server-2012-610763188.html includes   {{<pool-test-on-borrow>false</pool-test-on-borrow>}}.

We say this should be set to false on https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/tuning-database-connections-288657160.html

Other version specific docs do not include this:
* https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver071/connecting-jira-applications-to-sql-server-2008-802592183.html
* https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver071/connecting-jira-applications-to-mysql-802592179.html
fields.summary: pool-test-on-borrow set to false consistently across database docs
User Stories in status "In progress" automatically
Enhancing Reporting functionality

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-60494].
  {panel}

When time tracking is enabled the following fields are automatically added:

- Original Estimation
- Remaining Estimate
- Time Spent

A user cannot choose which of these fields they want to display. Being able to display specific time tracking fields would help customers in their workflow.
fields.summary: Allow for fine tuning of time tracking fields
